data.title: Resources/Shaders/example_Blur.fsh is not OpenGL ES 2.0 compliant

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

data.body:
The for loop in Resources/Shaders/example_Blur.fsh is not OpenGL ES 2.0 compliant and will not compile on some platforms that enforce the requirement that control flow be limited to forward branching and to loops where the maximum number of iterations can easily be determined at compile time. 

The use of the calculated value r from a uniform value means the maximum number of loop iterations cannot be known by the shader compiler. Angle for Windows 8.1 and 10 enforces this requirement. Other platforms may skip the for loop entirely without the compiler reporting an error.

The blur shader does the following:

uniform float blurRadius;
...
float r = blurRadius;
...
for(float x = -r; x < r; x += sampleStep) // error! compiler cannot unroll this loop 

The blur shader is not a correct GLSL shader.

See Appendix A section 4: Flow Control of the GLSL spec.

https://www.khronos.org/registry/gles/specs/2.0/GLSL_ES_Specification_1.0.17.pdf

When we move the layer(set position), the children will not follow.

milestone.title: v3.7.1
milestone.description:
This version is about to release with Cocos v2.3.2.
The core feature is Skeleton Animation support for Cocos Studio
It will provide Skeleton Animation for TimelineAction, its cpp/json parser, Lua/JS bindings,  web implementation.

void PhysicsWorld::debugDraw() 当body都删除后body的绘制还在
data.body:
问题描述：
    在一个场景中增加开启DebugDraw 增加 PhysicsBody 后，删除全部 PhysicsBody 则绘制的所有 DebugDraw 会一直存在。
问题代码：
在 void PhysicsWorld::debugDraw() 中当在下次绘制前将全部body都删除后会导致 下么判断失败，则直接跳过了所有操作，这是时候应该把 debugDraw 中的 DrawNode 都clear 才对。 
    if (_debugDraw && !_bodies.empty())

New Audio Engine Freezes game on android 5.0.2
data.body:
I have a game for ios and android. The new audio engine works well on ios but has a bug on android. I tested on android 5.0.2. To replicate the bug, quickly stop then play, stop then play, stop then play the same audio file all over again and again... In ios it's fine... The following is the log on android.

E/libOpenSLES(28903): frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:779: pthread_mutex_lock_timeout_np returned 110
E/libOpenSLES(28903): frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:779: pthread_mutex_lock_timeout_np returned 110
E/libOpenSLES(28903): frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:779: pthread_mutex_lock_timeout_np returned 110
E/libOpenSLES(28903): frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:779: pthread_mutex_lock_timeout_np returned 110
E/libOpenSLES(28903): frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:779: pthread_mutex_lock_timeout_np returned 110
E/libOpenSLES(28903): frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:779: pthread_mutex_lock_timeout_np returned 110
W/libOpenSLES(28903): frameworks/wilhelm/src/android/AudioPlayer_to_android.cpp:779: pthread 0xa1d33000 (tid 3931) sees object 0xaf65d600 was locked by pthread 0xb3d18000 (tid 2971) at frameworks/wilhelm/src/itf/IObject.c:411

Thanks for the help!
ginealgames
